page.title: 14The Old Mill
page.content: The mill is several hundred years old. The base is made of stone.The later additions were made of brick to support the sails.When it was working two or three men were needed to run it.This mill is unusual because it was both sail and wind powered,and later by an engine.The bottom layer had many rooms that were last occupied in 1860. The present owner is Mr Reeson.Born in the village although his father and grandfather were millers in Kirton nr. Boston.In 1912 the sails and water wheel were removed and the engine house was built.Now even this has gone .In 1965 the mill closed through lack of trade ( farmers ground their own meal). Today the mill is in a poor condition.The stone is crumbling,the wooden window frames and doors are rotting.There are no plans to renovate although its the only one of its kind.
